articles.headline: AI Diagnosis Outperforms Doctors by 94% Accuracy
articles.summary: Machine learning detects cancers missed by physicians.
articles.content: MIT research shows AI systems detect diseases earlier and more accurately. Radiology AI identified tumors in 94% of cases versus 65% for human doctors. Automated diagnosis reduces wait times 70%. AI consistency eliminates human error and fatigue factors.
articles.statementText: AI systems should be allowed to make autonomous decisions in healthcare diagnosis

articles.headline: Fatal AI Errors Expose Algorithmic Bias in Healthcare
articles.summary: Investigation reveals systematic discrimination in medical AI.
articles.content: ProPublica investigation found AI systems misdiagnose minorities 40% more often. Black box algorithms make unexplainable decisions. Legal liability unclear when AI errs. Human oversight essential for ethical medical practice.
articles.statementText: AI systems should be allowed to make autonomous decisions in healthcare diagnosis

articles.headline: Facial Recognition Solves 70% More Crimes in Major Cities
articles.summary: Technology helps locate missing children and catch criminals.
articles.content: FBI reports facial recognition identified 8,000 suspects last year. Missing children found 60% faster with technology. Airport security prevented 200 potential threats. Public safety improved measurably in monitored areas.
articles.statementText: Facial recognition technology in public spaces enhances safety more than it threatens privacy

articles.headline: Mass Surveillance Creates Authoritarian Infrastructure
articles.summary: Privacy advocates warn of social control through facial recognition.
articles.content: Electronic Frontier Foundation documents government abuse of surveillance tech. China's social credit system shows dystopian potential. Peaceful protesters tracked and arrested. Democratic freedoms erode under constant monitoring.
articles.statementText: Facial recognition technology in public spaces enhances safety more than it threatens privacy

articles.headline: AI Governance Requires Balancing Innovation and Protection
articles.summary: Experts propose frameworks for responsible development.
articles.content: Stanford AI Ethics review examines regulatory approaches globally. Benefits and risks vary by application and context. Transparent development with accountability mechanisms needed. International cooperation essential for effective governance.
